battlecode.common

Interface RobotController


  • public interface RobotController
    A RobotController allows contestants to make their robot sense and interact with the game world. When a contestant's RobotPlayer is constructed, it is passed an instance of RobotController that controls the newly created robot.

        Bytecode cost:

      • getDirtCarrying

        int getDirtCarrying()
        Returns the amount of dirt this robot is carrying. If the robot is a landscaper, this is the amount of dirt the robot is carrying. If the robot is a building, this is the amount of dirt that is on top of the building.
        Returns:
        the amount of dirt this robot is carrying.
        Bytecode cost:
        1

      • senseRobot

        RobotInfo senseRobot(int id)
              throws GameActionException
        Senses information about a particular robot given its ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the robot to query
        Returns:
        a RobotInfo object for the sensed robot.
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the robot cannot be sensed (for example, if it doesn't exist or is out of sensor range).
        Bytecode cost:
        25

      • senseNearbyRobots

        RobotInfo[] senseNearbyRobots()
        Returns all robots within sense radius. The objects are returned in no particular order.
        Returns:
        array of RobotInfo objects, which contain information about all the robots you sensed.
        Bytecode cost:
        100

      • senseNearbyRobots

        RobotInfo[] senseNearbyRobots(int radiusSquared)
        Returns all robots that can be sensed within a certain distance of this robot. The objects are returned in no particular order.
        Parameters:
        radiusSquared - return robots this distance away from the center of this robot. If -1 is passed, all robots within sense radius are returned.
        Returns:
        array of RobotInfo objects of all the robots you sensed.
        Bytecode cost:
        100

      • senseNearbyRobots

        RobotInfo[] senseNearbyRobots(int radiusSquared,
                              Team team)
        Returns all robots of a given team that can be sensed within a certain distance of this robot. The objects are returned in no particular order.
        Parameters:
        radiusSquared - return robots this distance away from the center of this robot. If -1 is passed, all robots within sense radius are returned
        team - filter game objects by the given team. If null is passed, robots from any team are returned
        Returns:
        array of RobotInfo objects of all the robots you sensed.
        Bytecode cost:
        100

      • senseNearbyRobots

        RobotInfo[] senseNearbyRobots(MapLocation center,
                              int radiusSquared,
                              Team team)
        Returns all robots of a given team that can be sensed within a certain radius of a specified location. The objects are returned in no particular order.
        Parameters:
        center - center of the given search radius
        radiusSquared - return robots this distance squared away from the given center location. If -1 is passed, all robots within sense radius are returned
        team - filter game objects by the given team. If null is passed, objects from all teams are returned
        Returns:
        sorted array of RobotInfo objects of the robots you sensed.
        Bytecode cost:
        100

      • senseNearbySoup

        MapLocation[] senseNearbySoup()
        Returns all map locations containing soup within sense radius. The locations are returned in no particular order.
        Returns:
        array of map locations that can be sensed containing soup
        Bytecode cost:
        100

      • senseNearbySoup

        MapLocation[] senseNearbySoup(int radiusSquared)
        Returns all map locations that can be sensed containing soup within specified radius. The locations are returned in no particular order.
        Parameters:
        radiusSquared - return soup locations this distance away from the center of this robot. If -1 is passed, all locations with soup within sense radius are returned
        Returns:
        array of map locations that can be sensed within the specified radius containing soup
        Bytecode cost:
        100

      • senseNearbySoup

        Parameters:
        center - center of the given search radius
        radiusSquared - return soup locations this distance away from the center of this robot. If -1 is passed, all locations with soup within sense radius are returned
        Returns:

        Bytecode cost:

      • isReady

        boolean isReady()
        Tests whether the robot can perform an action. Returns getCooldownTurns() < 1.
        Returns:
        true if the robot can perform an action.
        Bytecode cost:
        1

      • getCooldownTurns

        float getCooldownTurns()
        Returns the number of cooldown turns remaining before this unit can act again. When this number is strictly less than 1, isReady() is true and the robot can perform actions again.
        Returns:
        the number of cooldown turns remaining before this unit can act again.
        Bytecode cost:
        1

      • canMove

        boolean canMove(Direction dir)
        Tells whether this robot can move one step in the given direction. Returns false if the robot is a building, if the target location is not on the map, if the target location is occupied, if the dirt difference is too high and this robot is not a drone, and if the robot is ready based on the cooldown. Does not check if the location is flooded; suicide is permitted.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to move in
        Returns:
        true if it is possible to call move without an exception
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • move

        void move(Direction dir)
   throws GameActionException
        Moves one step in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to move in
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the robot cannot move one step in this direction, such as cooldown being >= 1, the target location being off the map, the target destination being occupied with either another robot, and the robot attempting to climb too high.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • canBuildRobot

        boolean canBuildRobot(RobotType type,
                      Direction dir)
        Tests whether the robot can build a robot of the given type in the given direction. Checks that the robot can build the desired type, that the team has enough soup, that the target location is on the map, that the target location is not occupied, that the target location is not flooded (unless trying to build a drone), that the dirt difference is within GameConstants.MAX_DIRT_DIFFERENCE, and that there are cooldown turns remaining.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to build in
        type - the type of robot to build
        Returns:
        whether it is possible to build a robot of the given type in the given direction.
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • buildRobot

        void buildRobot(RobotType type,
                Direction dir)
         throws GameActionException
        Builds a robot of the given type in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to spawn the unit
        type - the type of robot to build
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the conditions of canBuildRobot are not all satisfied.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • canMineSoup

        boolean canMineSoup(Direction dir)
        Tests whether the robot can mine soup in the given direction. Checks that the robot is a miner, that it has not yet reached its soup limit, that the target location is on the map, that there is soup on the target location, and that there are cooldown turns remaining.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to mine
        Returns:
        whether it is possible to mine soup in the given direction.
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • mineSoup

        void mineSoup(Direction dir)
       throws GameActionException
        Mines soup in the given direction. Mines up to GameConstants.SOUP_MINING_RATE, limited by how much soup the miner can still carry and how much soup exists at the location.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to mine
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the conditions of canMineSoup are all satisfied.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • canDepositSoup

        boolean canDepositSoup(Direction dir)
        Tests whether the robot can deposit soup in the given direction. Checks that the robot is a miner, that it is carrying soup, that the target location is on the map, that there is a refinery (or HQ) on the target location, and that there are cooldown turns remaining.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to deposit soup
        Returns:
        whether it is possible to deposit soup in the given direction.
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • depositSoup

        void depositSoup(Direction dir,
                 int amount)
          throws GameActionException
        Deposits soup in the given direction (max up to specified amount).
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to deposit soup
        amount - the amount of soup to deposit
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the conditions of canDepositSoup are not all satisfied.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • canDigDirt

        boolean canDigDirt(Direction dir)
        Tests whether the robot can dig dirt in the given direction. Checks that the robot is a landscaper, that it has not yet reached its dirt limit, that the target location is on the map, that it is not trying to dig underneath a building (that does not already have dirt on top of it), and that cooldown turns are remaining.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to dig in
        Returns:
        whether it is possible to dig dirt from the given direction.
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • digDirt

        void digDirt(Direction dir)
      throws GameActionException
        Digs dirt in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to dig in
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the conditions of canDigDirt are not all satisfied.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • canDepositDirt

        boolean canDepositDirt(Direction dir)
        Tests whether the robot can deposit dirt in the given direction. Checks that the robot is a landscaper, that it is carrying at least 1 unit of dirt, that the target location is on the map, and that cooldown turns are remaining.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to deposit
        Returns:
        whether it is possible to deposit dirt in the given direction.
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • depositDirt

        void depositDirt(Direction dir)
          throws GameActionException
        Deposits 1 unit of dirt in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to deposit
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the conditions of canDepositDirt are not all satisfied.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • canPickUpUnit

        boolean canPickUpUnit(int id)
        Tests whether a robot is able to pick up a specific unit. Checks whether this robot is a delivery drone that is not holding anything right now, whether the robot it is trying to be picked up can be picked up (and that that robot is not currently held by another drone), that the robot is within the pickup radius, and that there are cooldown turns remaining.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the robot to pick up
        Returns:
        true if robot with the id can be picked up, false otherwise
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • pickUpUnit

        void pickUpUnit(int id)
         throws GameActionException
        Picks up another unit.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the robot to pick up
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the conditions of canPickUpUnit are not all satisfied.
        Bytecode cost:
        5

      • canDropUnit

        boolean canDropUnit(Direction dir)
        Tests whether a robot is able to drop a unit in a specified direction. Checks whether the robot is a drone that is currently holding a unit, that the target location is unoccupied and on the map, and that there are cooldown turns remaining.
        Parameters:
        dir - the specified direction
        Returns:
        true if a robot can be dropped off, false otherwise
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • dropUnit

        void dropUnit(Direction dir)
       throws GameActionException
        Drops the unit that is currently picked up.
        Parameters:
        dir - the direction to drop in
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the conditions of canDropUnit are not all satisfied.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • canShootUnit

        boolean canShootUnit(int id)
        Tests whether a robot is able to shoot down a specific unit. Checks whether the robot is a net gun (or HQ), whether the target robot exists, can be shot and is in the shoot radius, and whether there are cooldown turns remaining.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the robot to shoot
        Returns:
        true if robot with the id can be shot down, false otherwise
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • shootUnit

        void shootUnit(int id)
        throws GameActionException
        Shoots down another unit.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the unit to shoot
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the conditions of canShootUnit are not all satisfied.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • disintegrate

        void disintegrate()
        Causes the robot to die. Never fails.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • resign

        void resign()
        Causes your team to lose the game. It's like typing "gg."
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • canSubmitTransaction

        boolean canSubmitTransaction(int[] message,
                             int cost)
        Checks that the robot can submit a transaction to the blockchain at the indicated cost. Tests if the team has enough soup, that the provided cost is positive, and that the message contains exactly 7 integers.
        Parameters:
        message - the list of ints to send (exactly GameConstants.BLOCKCHAIN_TRANSACTION_LENGTH of them).
        cost - the price that the unit is willing to pay for the message, in soup
        Returns:
        whether the transaction can be submitted or not
        Bytecode cost:
        10

      • submitTransaction

        void submitTransaction(int[] message,
                       int cost)
                throws GameActionException
        Submits a transaction to the transaction pool at the indicated cost. The transaction messages needs to be exactly 7 integers.
        Parameters:
        message - the list of ints to send.
        cost - the price that the unit is willing to pay for the message
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the team does not have enough soup to cover the cost, if the message is not of the right size, or if the cost is negative
        Bytecode cost:
        100

      • getBlock

        Transaction[] getBlock(int roundNumber)
                throws GameActionException
        Get the block of messages that was approved at a given round. The block will contain a list of transactions, and each transaction message will have exactly 7 integers.
        Parameters:
        roundNumber - the round index.
        Returns:
        an array of Transactions that were accepted into the blockchain at the given round, in no particular order.
        Throws:
        GameActionException - if the round is not available.
        Bytecode cost:
        100

        void setIndicatorDot(MapLocation loc,
                     int red,
                     int green,
                     int blue)
        Draw a dot on the game map for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        loc - the location to draw the dot.
        red - the red component of the dot's color.
        green - the green component of the dot's color.
        blue - the blue component of the dot's color.
        Bytecode cost:
        0

      • setIndicatorLine

        void setIndicatorLine(MapLocation startLoc,
                      MapLocation endLoc,
                      int red,
                      int green,
                      int blue)
        Draw a line on the game map for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        startLoc - the location to draw the line from.
        endLoc - the location to draw the line to.
        red - the red component of the line's color.
        green - the green component of the line's color.
        blue - the blue component of the line's color.
        Bytecode cost:
        0
